data.title: No Longer in Business, and for good reason.
data.text: Finally this place went out of business. Bar was small and always full of rowdy, cursing drunk women. Cursing worse than drunk, angry sailors! The two times I visited I left disgusted. Beers were expensive too. Good riddance!

data.title: Great Service, Lousy Food
data.text: After living in Folsom for little over a year, my wife and I finally decided to go to Hampton's to ring in 2016 with a visit to a place we haven't been before, although now I wish we hadn't. While the service was excellent, my wife and I and our friends were extremely underwhelmed with the quality of food and more than suspicious of its pricing. Fourteen dollars for a (literal) half head of lettuce and store-bought dressing? No thanks. Another $14 for a French Dip that was mostly bread and no cheese. Again, no thanks. If it wasn't for the excellent service we received, I would have nothing good to say about this place.

data.title: Nice location
data.text: Nice bar service, friendly and attentive.  Menu is a little limited, but we enjoyed everything we ordered.  Would return.

data.title: Horrible Service
data.text: Well what little service we got before we walked out. Six of us stood waiting to be seated as the sign asked. While just being looked at by staff. Once seated we asked if she could turn on the ceiling fan it was warm. "We'll see" she said and walked off not asking if we wanted drinks or anything. And we sat....and sat....then left. This is the second chance we gave this place.

data.title: Food was good but service was terrible
data.text: We made a reservation for dinner and some of us showed up early for drinks. We were seated in the front lounge furniture and were promptly forgotten about. We had to go in to order drinks, several of which came back incorrect. I ordered white wine and was brought red. The worst was my friend ordered a mixed drink and the bartender added the wrong type of alcohol. When we sent it back we were met with attitude and we are pretty sure she just brought us back the same glass. The second time that we pushed back she brought us a new drink but the one that was wrong was added to the bill. The food was good but the server's attitude was terrible. we sat on the back patio for dinner and they turned the lights off on us at 8:30 even though they are open till 9. I don't think we will go back. The food was good but the meal was more expensive than I felt it was worth. I ordered a glass of wine and a hamburger and my bill alone was $35.

data.title: Our Puppy was Welcome, and Food is Great
data.text: This is one of the few places in Old Town that truly welcomes dogs. They were hospitable to us and to our baby, whom they brought water almost before we sat down. The service and food was very good - indeed, my fish and chips was some of the best I've had anywhere. Nice folk and food.

data.title: Great Outdoor Seating
data.text: Casual eateries with good burgers and sandwiches. Haven't been there for brunch, but they're always pretty busy on weekend mornings. Three levels of outdoor seating makes this a lovely fair weather destination.

data.title: Not super impressed
data.text:
I had the steak sandwich, as did my wife. Hers came without lettuce and tomatoes on the plate. Mine did. Hers had this dollop of minced garlic spread on the plate that mine didn't. Which was a shame, because that spread was the best thing about the sandwich. The onion rings on the sandwich were also tasty. 

She got the clam chowder, as did my son, and they both said it was very good. Creamy, buttery, and delicious.  

I got the fried pickles. I love fried pickles. I urge you, please don't eat the fried pickles here. They were completely soggy. Not a single bite had the tiniest crunch. 

Both my son and daughter had a burger and they both said they were great. The meat looked like they cooked it properly (they both order medium rare) and the fixings were good. 

The fried were also oddly soggy. 

I had a Bourbon Smash and it was very good. My wife loved their elderflower gimlet. 

I would not recommend it.  I guess I should have gotten the burger.

data.title: Expensive for average quality food
data.text: Typical bar food - burgers, sandwiches, etc, nothing creative about the menu. Service was good. The prices didn't feel justified by the food or the location.

data.title: Kind of Pricey
data.text: Kind of pricey for the food that you get.  Burger was only slightly better than average.  The portion of frys was small.  Beer is about $6 a pint.  The town area is very nice and the dining facility is also nice.  The server were very nice but the food was slow in coming.  Maybe worth a one time deal but much improvement needs to be made for the cost.

data.title: Nice
data.text: food was ok, I came for the drinks.  Nice outdoor area to hang with friends.  great people watching place

data.title: OK for a quick burger and beer
data.text: My child bride used to visit Folsom's restaurants on a regular basis when she lived in the area, so we re-visited Sutter St. for the nostalgia.  Hampton's is a relatively new place, but seemed promising.  Service was moderately slow, but friendly.  The burgers were OK.  The brews were also ... OK. Probably will explore other options when next we visit Folsom.

data.title: " Hamburger Place"
data.text: A place people rave about the hamburgers. My last visit I had their teriyaki Ahi pasta; I was not dissapointed. Save room for a taste of one of their desserts.(Caramel cake)

data.title: Dropped in on a Sunday for lunch.
data.text: Waitstaff is very friendly and attentive. Ordered the The Flaming Burger, added bacon. Excellent flavor cooked to order - not overpowering heat, good seasoning. Will def try again next time we are in the area!

data.title: Nice place, great food
data.text: Our first visit to this restaurant.  The wait was short.  Service was mediocre but it seemed like she might have been new.  The live music downstairs was great.  Food was very good.  I would recommend to anyone looking for good food in a fun atmosphere.

data.title: What a nice surprise!
data.text: We were looking for a restaurant on Sutter St. in old town Folsom and stumbled upon Hampton's.  Sat outside on the patio and the weather was beautiful.  We had pitchers of mojitos and they were awesome!  Had the calamari and loved it; the sauce has a perfect kick.  I had the cajun bleu burger and it was awesome!!  If you are hungry, upgrade $2 to the larger patty size.  (In hindsight, I should've done that!)  My friends had other burgers and salads and they loved theirs as well.  We've been coming to this area for years and have never tried this restaurant until now.  Great choice!!  Will definitely be back!!

data.title: Great local experience
data.text: An 1894 constables house renovated into a lovely dining experience .Lots of outdoor dining - and a menu that suits all palettes. The coup d'etat is the beer menu - local boutique breweries with a flair for flavor. Great service at reasonable prices - an all round good dining experience .

data.title: Too loud, bad service, food is hit/miss
data.text: We stopped in last Friday for Dinner.  Place was busy, we were told a 15 minute wait for outside seating.  35 minutes later, were shown to a table....inside.  With barstools as "chairs"-no backs.  We stated we had requested outdoor seating.  Apologies made, but they wouldn't tell us how long it would be for an outside table.  Really? Just take a guess, guys, it's very frustrating waiting longer than told, then not given seating preference.  Other server came and said table had opened up outside.  We were led to a back corner, where a disgusting (as in filthy/broken) table with a broken umbrella pole  (minus the umbrella) lay across it.  We actually looked at them and said, "are you kidding? ".  So back inside we went.  Noise level was so ridiculously loud, server suggested we open window at our table to maybe help minimize the noise. She opened the window and left, only to return one minute later telling us manager had told her to close the window due to air conditioner running.  O.k., so placed order.  Fried calamari was bland, when on previous visit had been outstanding.  The steak sandwich had way too much grizzle and was too tough.  C'mon, charge a little extra and serve a better cut of meat.  Husband's burger was good.  Server was good with one exception-she kept pushing the dessert and telling us they were so big they were meant to be shared-well, we ordered one chocolate cake and were presented with a cupcake-no icing, just chocolate and caramel sauced drizzled on top.  AND 3 SPOONS.  Dessert alert-go to Cheesecake factory if you want to share a chocolate cake, and it will cost less. Overall, such a bad experience, we won't return.  Better and quieter restaurants in Folsom with MUCH better service.

data.title: Not Impressed
data.text: We stopped here on a Sunday morning because there was a sandwich board outside promoting breakfast. My husband ordered a waffle and was told they were out of waffles! ??? Why? Do they serve frozen waffles? When he asked for jam, he was given a bottle of Smucker's strawberry fruit spread in a gross squeeze bottle. My chicken sandwich was average. All in all, a disappointing experience.

data.title: Great place to eat!
data.text: This is a new restaurant and is nicely decorated.  The patio was a great place to eat on a Spring day and the food was good.  Will definitely come back.
